intro: Phlomoides sanglechensis, commonly known as the Sanglech grass, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow to brown florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
